item.title: Resume
item.description: Employment Backend Software Engineer: Turo Nov 2018 - Present Turo is the largest Peer-to-Peer car sharing platform that operates in the United States, Canada, the U.K. and Germany. Designed, and implemented the back end for Turo Go Digital: a software solution to remotely lock, unlock, and pull state from vehicles Worked with Java, Kotlin, and MySQL Participated in cross functional product teams; collaborate with stakeholders across domains within and external to the company Completed a significant upgrade of Turo’s vehicle delivery product to allow delivery to airports, hotels, and other points of interest Ran interviews for hiring new back end engineers Backend Software Engineer: Copia Sept 2017 - Nov 2018

item.title: Programming
item.description: Projects Fotingo-emacs fotingo-emacs is an Emacs interface to the cli tool fotingo. Fotingo is a CLI to ease the interaction between Git, Github and Jira when working on tasks. fotingo-emacs aims to provide the same level of convenience provided by Magit and is designed to follow a similar workflow. dotfiles Configuration for all the tools I use; .spacemacs may be of interest for Emacs enthusiasts. DynamoInverter A library for turning DynamoDb QuerySpec and ScanSpec objects into SQL strings that can be processed by JDBC to standardize database interactions around AWS objects.

item.title: Personal
item.description: Outdoor Hiking For day hikes, look at satellite views first to determine if it’s a “road” hike For COVID-19 hikes you need to drive a couple hours away from the city to miss crowds Always plan a fallback hike Bring chairs/comfort items on day hikes North America Pinancles National Park. Good day trip Gold Bluffs beach campground Almost a 7 hour drive No reservations after sept 28 Zion national park traverse Graeagle is apparently a cool spot to go Hiking(from Jack Trout) Completed
